keyword: how many calories in a teaspoon of olive oil
title: How Many Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a teaspoon of olive oil, including full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and simple tweaks for cooking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil?
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 teaspoon = 5 ml ≈ 4.5 g; pure oil, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive variety, processing, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of olive oil contains about 40 kcal, all from healthy fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use regular olive oil (slightly lower monounsaturated fats)
Add to salad dressing with vinegar (no calorie change from oil alone)

faqs.q: How many calories in a teaspoon of olive oil?
Is olive oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, it's 100% fat—about 4.5 g per teaspoon, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No, 0 g carbs and 0 g protein per teaspoon.

faqs.q: What's the difference between extra virgin and regular olive oil calories?
faqs.a: Calorie content is the same (40 kcal per tsp); differences are in flavor and antioxidants.

faqs.q: How many teaspoons in a tablespoon of olive oil?
faqs.a: Three teaspoons equal one tablespoon, so about 120 kcal per tablespoon.
